SENT.plain: A 49-year-old man was hospitalized because of cutaneous plaques and pancytopenia
Hematological findings, and the skin eruption suggested Sweet's syndrome associated with myelodysplastic syndrome (refractory anemia with excess of blasts; RAEB)
Treatment for pancytopenia was attempted without effect
Also we tried treatment with antibiotics
The skin lesions healed and the body temperature returned to normal
This case was unusual in the association of myelodysplastic syndrome with Sweet's syndrome
